metadata.title: USN-5503-1 -- GnuPG vulnerability
metadata.description: Demi Marie Obenour discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled injection in the status message. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to forge signatures.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5503-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  dirmngr - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpgv-static - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gnupg - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 scdaemon - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpgsm - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpgv - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpg - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gnupg-agent - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gnupg2 - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpgv2 - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpg-wks-client - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gnupg-l10n - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpg-wks-server - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpg-agent - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpgv-win32 - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gnupg-utils - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 gpgconf - 2.2.27-3ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
